did.unittitle: Presbyterian Social Union of Philadelphia and Vicinity records

bioghist.p: The object of the Presbyterian Social Union of Philadelphia and Vicinity was "to encourage among the members of the Presbyterian Churches a more friendly and intimate acquaintance, to secure concert action, and to promote the general interests of Presbyterianism in this vicinity." John Wanamaker was the first president.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Presbyterian Social Union of Philadelphia and Vicinity. Materials include: manuscript page from 1888 describing the first meeting of the Presbyterian Social Union, presided over by John Wanamaker; a volume of minutes, 1890-1915 with treasurer's reports, resolutions, lists of addresses given, nominations, and programs; copies of the constitution and by-laws and a history of the Presbyterian Social Union; lists of members; programs and menus from annual banquets (1901-1944, with gaps); and reports of the Outlook Committee, 1924-1967. The reports present in narrative form the committee's positions on a variety of themes, including evangelism, foreign missions, atheism, Presbyterian projects and programs, problems of the inner city, senior citizens, and the function of the layman in the church.
